trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Zscaler Beta | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Zscaler Beta | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Zscaler Beta with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Zscaler Beta with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Zscaler Beta
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Zscaler Beta

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP]For feedback, click [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=614877).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP]For feedback, click [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=614877).

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and ZScaler Beta.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and ZScaler Beta.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A ZScaler Beta single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A ZScaler Beta single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to ZScaler Beta will be able to single sign into the application at your ZScaler Beta company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586)
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to ZScaler Beta will be able to single sign into the application at your ZScaler Beta company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586)

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for ZScaler Beta
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for ZScaler Beta

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring proxy settings
trans-unit.target: Configuring proxy settings

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: Scenario
trans-unit.target: Scenario

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for ZScaler Beta
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for ZScaler Beta

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for ZScaler Beta.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for ZScaler Beta.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for ZScaler Beta, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for ZScaler Beta, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Active Directory

trans-unit.source: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: Applications
trans-unit.target: Applications

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Add application
trans-unit.target: Add application

trans-unit.source: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.
trans-unit.target: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.

trans-unit.source: Add an application from gallerry
trans-unit.target: Add an application from gallerry

trans-unit.source: In the **search box**, type **ZScaler Beta**.
trans-unit.target: In the **search box**, type **ZScaler Beta**.

trans-unit.source: Application Gallery
trans-unit.target: Application Gallery

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select **ZScaler Beta**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select **ZScaler Beta**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.

trans-unit.source: ZScaler One
trans-unit.target: ZScaler One

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to ZScaler Beta with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to ZScaler Beta with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your ZScaler Beta tenant.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your ZScaler Beta tenant.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see [How to convert a binary certificate into a text file](http://youtu.be/PlgrzUZ-Y1o)
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see [How to convert a binary certificate into a text file](http://youtu.be/PlgrzUZ-Y1o)

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the **ZScaler Beta** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign On ** dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the **ZScaler Beta** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign On ** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: On the **How would you like users to sign on to ZScaler Beta** page, select **Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **How would you like users to sign on to ZScaler Beta** page, select **Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure App URL** page, in the **ZScaler Beta Sign On URL** textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign-on to your ZScaler Beta application, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure App URL** page, in the **ZScaler Beta Sign On URL** textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign-on to your ZScaler Beta application, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Configure App URL
trans-unit.target: Configure App URL

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can get the actual value for your environment from your ZScaler Beta support team if you need it.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can get the actual value for your environment from your ZScaler Beta support team if you need it.

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure single sign-on at ZScaler Beta** page, to download your certificate, click **Download certificate**, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure single sign-on at ZScaler Beta** page, to download your certificate, click **Download certificate**, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your ZScaler Beta company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your ZScaler Beta company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click **Administration**.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click **Administration**.

trans-unit.source: Administration
trans-unit.target: Administration

trans-unit.source: Under **Manage Administrators & Roles**, click **Manage Users & Authentication**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Manage Administrators & Roles**, click **Manage Users & Authentication**.

trans-unit.source: Manage Users & Authentication
trans-unit.target: Manage Users & Authentication

trans-unit.source: In the **Choose Authentication Options for your Organization** section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the **Choose Authentication Options for your Organization** section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Authentication
trans-unit.target: Authentication

trans-unit.source: Select **Authenticate using SAML Single Sign-On**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Authenticate using SAML Single Sign-On**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Configure SAML Single Sign-On Parameters**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Configure SAML Single Sign-On Parameters**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure SAML Single Sign-On Parameters** dialog page, perform the following steps, and then click **Done**:
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure SAML Single Sign-On Parameters** dialog page, perform the following steps, and then click **Done**:

trans-unit.source: Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at ZScaler Beta** dialog page, copy the **Authentication Request URL** value, and then paste it into the **URL of the SAML Portal to which users are sent for authentication** textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at ZScaler Beta** dialog page, copy the **Authentication Request URL** value, and then paste it into the **URL of the SAML Portal to which users are sent for authentication** textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the **Attribute containing Login Name** textbox, type **NameID**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Attribute containing Login Name** textbox, type **NameID**.

trans-unit.source: To upload your downloaded certificate, click **Zscaler pem**.
trans-unit.target: To upload your downloaded certificate, click **Zscaler pem**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Enable SAML Auto-Provisioning**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Enable SAML Auto-Provisioning**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure User Authentication** dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure User Authentication** dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Administration
trans-unit.target: Administration

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Activate Now**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Activate Now**.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at ZScaler Beta** dialog page, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Complete**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the **Configure single sign-on at ZScaler Beta** dialog page, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Complete**.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: Configuring proxy settings
trans-unit.target: Configuring proxy settings

trans-unit.source: To configure the proxy settings in Internet Explorer
trans-unit.target: To configure the proxy settings in Internet Explorer

trans-unit.source: Start **Internet Explorer**.
trans-unit.target: Start **Internet Explorer**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Internet options** from the **Tools** menu to open the **Internet Options** dialog.
trans-unit.target: Select **Internet options** from the **Tools** menu to open the **Internet Options** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Internet Options
trans-unit.target: Internet Options

trans-unit.source: Click the **Connections** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Connections** tab.

trans-unit.source: Connections
trans-unit.target: Connections

trans-unit.source: Click **LAN settings** to open the **LAN Settings** dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click **LAN settings** to open the **LAN Settings** dialog.

trans-unit.source: In the Proxy server section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Proxy server section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Proxy server
trans-unit.target: Proxy server

trans-unit.source: Select Use a proxy server for your LAN.
trans-unit.target: Select Use a proxy server for your LAN.

trans-unit.source: In the Address textbox, type **gateway.zscalerBeta.net**.
trans-unit.target: In the Address textbox, type **gateway.zscalerBeta.net**.

trans-unit.source: In the Port textbox, type **80**.
trans-unit.target: In the Port textbox, type **80**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Bypass proxy server for local addresses**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Bypass proxy server for local addresses**.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to close the **Local Area Network (LAN) Settings** dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to close the **Local Area Network (LAN) Settings** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to close the **Internet Options** dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to close the **Internet Options** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into ZScaler Beta, they must be provisioned to ZScaler Beta.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into ZScaler Beta, they must be provisioned to ZScaler Beta.

trans-unit.source: In the case of ZScaler Beta, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of ZScaler Beta, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Log in to your **Zscaler** tenant.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your **Zscaler** tenant.

trans-unit.source: Click **Administration**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Administration**.

trans-unit.source: Administration
trans-unit.target: Administration

trans-unit.source: Click **User Management**.
trans-unit.target: Click **User Management**.

trans-unit.source: Add
trans-unit.target: Add

trans-unit.source: In the **Users** tab, click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Users** tab, click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Add
trans-unit.target: Add

trans-unit.source: In the Add User section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Add User section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Add User
trans-unit.target: Add User

trans-unit.source: Type the **UserID**, **User Display Name**, **Password**, **Confirm Password**, and then select **Groups** and the **Department** of a valid AAD account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: Type the **UserID**, **User Display Name**, **Password**, **Confirm Password**, and then select **Groups** and the **Department** of a valid AAD account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can use any other ZScaler Beta user account creation tools or APIs provided by ZScaler Beta to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can use any other ZScaler Beta user account creation tools or APIs provided by ZScaler Beta to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to ZScaler Beta, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to ZScaler Beta, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the **ZScaler Beta** application integration page, click **Assign users**.
trans-unit.target: On the **ZScaler Beta** application integration page, click **Assign users**.

trans-unit.source: Assign Users
trans-unit.target: Assign Users

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click **Assign**, and then click **Yes** to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click **Assign**, and then click **Yes** to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586).
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
